ch.ethz.rtc.kernel
Class PeriodicPart

java.lang.Object
  ch.ethz.rtc.kernel.PeriodicPart
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class PeriodicPart
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

AperiodicPartr represents the periodic part of a curve.

Constructor Detail

PeriodicPart

public PeriodicPart(SegmentList segmentList,
                    double px0,
                    double py0,
                    long period,
                    double pdy)
Constructs a PerdiodicPart from the passed arguments. pdy may be NaN, then pdy is computed to equal the y-coordinate of the SegmentList at pdx.

Parameters:
segmentList - the SegmentList.
px0 - the x-coordinate where this PeriodicPart starts.
py0 - the y-coordinate where this PeriodicPart starts.
period - the period of this PeriodicPart.
pdy - the periodic offset of this PeriodicPart.

PeriodicPart

public PeriodicPart(double[][] segmentList,
                    double px0,
                    double py0,
                    long period,
                    double pdy)
Constructs a PeriodicPart from a double[][] of the form [[x1 y1 s1];[x2 y2 s2];[x3 y3 s3]] and the additional parameters. This constructor is intended for use with Matlab.

Parameters:
segmentList - the double[][]

public PeriodicPart(java.lang.String str)

Parameters:
str - the String of form "[[x1 y1 s1];[x2 y2 s2];[x3 y3 s3]],px0,py0,period,pdy"

public double pdy()
Returns the delta on the y-axis between two consecutive repetitions of this PeriodicPart, i.e. the offset.

Returns:
the delta on the y-axis between two consecutive repetitions of this PeriodicPart, i.e. the offset. .

pds

public double pds()
Returns the overall slope of this PeriodicPart: pds = pdy / pdx.

Returns:
the overall slope of this PeriodicPart.

pyMin

public double pyMin()
Returns the minimum y-value of this PeriodicPart within x = [0,pdx] in the relative coordinate system with origin (px0/py0).

Returns:
the minimum y-value of this PeriodicPart.

pyMax

public double pyMax()
Returns the maximum y-value of this PeriodicPart within x = [0,pdx] in the relative coordinate system with origin (px0/py0).

Returns:
the maximum y-value of this PeriodicPart.

scaleX

public void scaleX(double factor)
Scale this PeriodicPart along the x-axis. The result of the multiplication (factor * pdx) must be an integer!

Parameters:
factor - the factor to scale this PeriodicPart.

scaleY

public void scaleY(double factor)
Scale this PeriodicPart along the y-axis.

Parameters:
factor - the factor to scale this PeriodicPart.

move

public AperiodicPart move(double dx,
                          double dy)
Move this PeriodicPart by (dx,dy). If dx is negative, it may happen that px0 becomes negative. In this case, px0 is set to the start point of the first periodic repetition that starts at a positive x-coordinate. If this first positive x-coordinate does not equal 0.0, then an AperiodicPart is returned that represents the fractional part from 0.0 up to the new px0. In any other case, null is returned.

Parameters:
dx - the x-value by which this PeriodicPart is moved.
dy - the y-value by which this PeriodicPart is moved.

round

public void round()
Round all points that define this PeriodicPart. This includes all start points of all segments, all slopes, as well as px0, py0, pdy. All related values such as slopes and pds, pyMin and pyMax are new calculated.
